elements.title: Leiv Eirikson Discovering America (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Christian Krohg's painting Leiv Eirikson Discovering America (pictured) was shown at the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition together with a replica of a Viking ship?

elements.title: Plecia avus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that upon the redescription of the fossil marchfly Plecia avus, an additional seven specimens were identified?

elements.title: Airport Central railway station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Perth's Airport Central railway station, which opens today, has the longest operating escalators in the southern hemisphere?

elements.title: Fred Franzia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Fred Franzia created Two-Buck Chuck, he was said to have "turned the wine industry on its head"?

elements.title: oil refineries in Turkmenistan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while oil and gas production is a large part of Turkmenistan's economy, there are only two oil refineries in Turkmenistan?

elements.title: Herb Lusk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Herb Lusk retired from the National Football League at the age of 26 to become a minister?

elements.title: Slow River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nicola Griffith's Slow River, described as a lesbian romance, features a "sophisticated depiction of environmental management"?

elements.title: a Catholic radio station in Texas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Catholic radio station in Texas wields the "velvet hammer" to promote Christianity?
